title: 112_hr6558
content: The Act may be cited as the "Student Financial Aid Simplification Act" and includes FAFSA simplification. Section 483 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include FAFSA simplification for students who are taxpayers or dependents of taxpayers. Effective from the academic year 2013-2014 onwards, this amendment overrides certain provisions for determining need and eligibility. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to simplify FAFSA for student taxpayers or dependents. The amendment allows the Secretary to obtain income data from the IRS for determining financial assistance eligibility. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to simplify FAFSA for student taxpayers or dependents. The amendment allows the Secretary to obtain income data from the IRS for determining financial assistance eligibility. Institutions of higher education and States can receive necessary information from the Secretary for processing loan applications and determining financial aid eligibility. Students applying for financial assistance must submit additional information as required by the Secretary to determine eligibility and administer financial aid programs. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to simplify FAFSA for student taxpayers or dependents by allowing the Secretary to obtain income data from the IRS. This includes information such as citizenship status, dependency status, selective service registration, legal residence, family members, education status, drug convictions, degree completion, email address, and enrolled institutions. The Secretary will prescribe regulations necessary for carrying out the education enrollment or admission process, exempt from certain rulemaking requirements. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. Section 6103(l) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow the Secretary to disclose return information to the Department of Education for determining a student's eligibility for federal student financial aid based on income. The amended Section 6103(l) of the Internal Revenue Code allows the disclosure of taxpayer information to the Department of Education for determining eligibility for federal student financial aid based on income. This includes taxpayer identity, filing status, adjusted gross income, and other necessary data for calculating expected family contribution. The disclosed information can only be used by authorized officers and employees. The Department of Education can use taxpayer information to process student loan applications and determine eligibility for Federal student financial aid under specific guidelines.
